questions: What is the total value of your current assets (e.g. cash, receivables, inventory) as of the most recent reporting period?
What are your current liabilities, such as short-term debt, accounts payable, and accrued expenses?
Have there been any significant changes in your working capital in the last 12 months?
Are there any unusual or non-recurring items included in your current assets or liabilities?
What is your total outstanding debt, including both short-term and long-term liabilities?
How much of your capital is financed through equity versus debt?
Has there been any recent capital injection or withdrawal?
Are there any off-balance sheet obligations or guarantees that should be considered?
What is your total funded debt (i.e., interest-bearing debt with a maturity over one year)?
Can you break down your debt between secured and unsecured obligations?
What is your EBITDA for the trailing twelve months (TTM)?
Are there any covenant adjustments to EBITDA (e.g., add-backs for one-time expenses)?
Have there been any recent significant changes to your capital structure?
What was your Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) for the most recent year or quarter?
What is the total amount of debt service due during the year (i.e., scheduled principal and interest payments)?
Do you have any balloon payments or lump-sum obligations due within the next 12 months?
Are there any non-operating income or expenses that should be excluded from EBITDA?
Have any debt repayments been deferred or restructured?
